reviews.review_msg: keep talking about joke during class and tests are extremely hard. worst professor for OB
Actually sometimes u can do self-learning with notes without listening his lecture and if u read book u can get almost full scores in MCQ.

He is my professor for Organizational Behaviour. He is really funny, he makes the class really interesting. However, without the the attendance sheet you wouldnt need to go to that class. He is hard marking, but almost all his exams are MCQs and confusing

Even though people hate this guy, i claim the opposite. I loved taking this class with him because it was kind of chilled. Advise is, just make sure you read your text cause you wont get much from him during lectures. He is kind of strict but nothing extreme. Exams are easy if you read/study. Just be on his good side and you will enjoy the class :)

His time management is not so good and his lecture is not as helpful as it is supposed to be. Even though he is kind of strict,he is a funny guy and his classes are not boring, his exams are easy and manageable.Reading the text will and adding more effort in assignments and tests will definitely guarantee you an A+
2016 Kyrie Irving

Engaging prof who records lectures - super helpful for exams. Attendance is a must. The group project can make or break your grade, so pick your team wisely. Don't forget to use unstuck study for extra study support!

He is very approachable and knowledgeable. If you ask him a question, he will give you a comprehensive answer. 
To succeed in exams, pay attention to everything he says during lectures, including examples. I found his lectures to be interesting and enjoyable.

Knowledgeable in OB topics and the exams draw quite heavily on very specific and niche scenarios - so know your terms. The TA's can be a hit or miss, as mine was frequently late and marked a little harshly. Be prepared for the group projects, as they take up a significant portion of your mark and your group will make or break your grade.

Mad respect this professor! Very engaging lectures and very approachable. He's willing to keep in touch with you long term, if you a business major that is a great way to build connections and network. Lecutures are super useful for studying for exams, he records all his lectures and tests you on examples talked about in class. Overall Awesome prof

Recommend taking the course with Chris. His lectures are great, and some exam questions are based on lecture discussions. Just hope you get a good TA, as everything is marked by them. Midterm and final were multiple choice, so make sure you memorize the concepts.

The prof is great and the class was pretty engaging, and it helped that they were recorded. Make sure you take note of what he says in class especially the examples because those are tested. My only concern was the group project because it tanked my grade a little which wasn't even my fault but otherwise take it with Chris if possible.

Amazing prof. Easily top 5 at beedie. The reviews don't lie, he really knows his stuff and cares about the class. Records all lectures which is extremely useful to the final and midterm as he uses specific examples mentioned in class in them. Would take again!

Probably the best prof I have had so far. Knows what he is talking about and is approachable for help. Exams are heavily based on course material - I would take note of basically every time he says "for example" in lecture. there's a group project and it makes up a good percentage of your final grade. Would take this prof again for any other class!

Great prof - records lectures! Content can get dry but Chris makes it almost enjoyable. I recommend listening to his lectures 2x speed cus exam questions come from specific vids and examples. Did well on the exams but the group projects can get you screwed (had a terrible group+TA) talk to your TA about everything and get them to check ur paper.
Lecture heavy class, would recommend going and participating, which is easy as Chris gives a very engaging and well delivered lecture.

Grading scheme went by 2 assignments, 1 final paper, 3 exams. More of a psychology/HR perspective on Business course. Zatzick was a nice and caring prof, would love to take another course with him, but I personally found the course content difficult to motivate myself to learn.

I wouldn't say his exams are tha similar to his lectures. this was one of my first bus classes and my advice is to actually understand every theory and apply them to different situations in the real world rather than trying to know what each theory is. I was hoping to do well in this class but I fell short...

Chris is awesome, cares for his students, provides sufficient structure for course evals, and spends time to ensure lectures are engaging and students understand all concepts presented. There is little room for error if you're going for the A+. To score highly, attend all lectures, focus on understanding rather than memorizing concepts.

Mr. Zatzick is a decent professor for Bus272, you need to actively participate in the class and pay attention to the material he discusses during the lectures to do well in the exams. His grading criteria is fairly straightforward and if you attend his lectures regularly, you should be able to do well in the course.
Chris was a really good lecturer and cares about his students. Tests were only on the lectures so don't bother getting the textbook.

Chris was a great professor. The class was really easy and interesting. He doesn't use textbooks and only lecture material is used for exams which were really nice. If you don't participate in lectures and take detailed notes, you're probably going to barely pass.
Zatzick is a smart guy whose lectures are really engaging. Basically all of his assignments and exams are based on lecture material; textbook was practically useless.

In bus 272 he was great. My only issue was him was that he asked so many questions on the exams based off class discussions and I wasnt always there or paying attention. I guess thats my fault and thats why I didnt do better. Getting an A in his class is totally doable just show up and take notes. I was lazy :(

Chris delves into detailed examples that help to illustrate key concepts in the material. He also just picks out the most important concepts from each chapter and doesn't test on anything not mentioned in class. If you revise his audio recordings, you will be fine, just make sure to study his examples and what they illustrate.

He's a great prof and gives lots of examples which really helps to understand. If you take his class, take notes on class discussions and be present in his lectures, a lot of his exam questions are based on these discussions and examples only mentioned in his lecture. I took it in person and he also offered audio recordings so it worked out.

I took him in my first year when I was having academic difficulties, amazing professor, wants everyone to succeed and extremely understanding, his midterm was mainly MC and some writing, read the parts he tells you to read in the textbook and you'll be fine, final was all MCQ if I recall correctly, same difficulty as the midterm. Just memorize.
Refuses to change grades even when there has been a mistake. Overall Chris's class was a poor experience.

After classes were switched midway through the semester to online learning due to COVID, there was an error in my final participation grade. My TA told me to reach out to Chris to get it fixed. Chris refused to change my grade as it would affect the curve. I was less than 0.3% away from an A-, and his laziness prevented me from getting straight A's

His lectures were pretty good and he kept most of it pretty interesting. But you do need to show up to his lectures because a lot of the questions on the exams come straight out of the lecture, not so much the textbook. Exams aren't too hard but some of the questions can be pretty tricky. Also, there was a group paper but I found it really boring.
First said tb was mandatory but then said only lecture materials were testable. Q's on exams ask for the specific examples of examples used in class, so write everything down.

awesome prof, super understanding and caring. his lectures are chill but u do need to listen to be able to answer the midterm questions (he refers back to his quotes and stories). really enjoyed the course material

Chris genuinely cares about his students. He is understanding and flexible. Although the material was boring and a lot of it was memorization, he always connected the content to real life applications. Exams were fair, multiple choice can be tricky.

Chris is a great prof who knows how to take real life examples for students to relate to the material. Make sure you attend the lectures because his exams are mainly based on the lectures, which wont be that hard if you listen to him. Definitely one of the best profs Ive had in SFU.

Chris is a phenomenal professor! The best so far in my undergrad. Super passionate about HR, makes the class straightforward, and takes advantage of the applicability of OB by providing real life examples! His teaching style is exceptional and impactful. Would take another course of his in a heartbeat. A+ professor.

Amazing lectures, Chris has an effective teaching style which engages his students. He is very approachable, understanding and caters to the needs of the class. One of the most engaging professors at SFU!
Great professor with great lectures. He cares about students and exam was relatively fair. Definitely should take for Bus 272.

He is a great professor, explains very well. His exams are based on what he talks about in the class. The textbook can be used for reference but you only need to focus on his lecture, he has questions which focus on the specific examples he used in the lectures, which you won't find in the book or in the lecture slides. An amazing prof for sure.

BEST PROF EVER! its always better to take bus 272 in Burnaby instead of surrey anyways for business classes cuz they have better profs!! HES AMAZING and he tells you exactly whats on the final and his teavhing style is just splendid.
Great prof for bus272. Super clear lecture slides. Just study his slides for midterms and the final. Very interesting lectures. Will def take his class again!

Chris is a great prof, great lecturer, helpful. However, the grade you get largely depends on your TA because they are the ones that grade your exams and group paper. The group paper was 12 pages, marked extremely difficult, and hard to do. The midterm was fairly easy in the MC section, but since TAs mark SA section, you can do poorly.

Amazing prof!!!  If you take notes during his lectures you won't even need to use your textbook.  Everything from his slides is on the exams.  Saying that though, his exams are tough and there are multiple answers that look right so you have to take your time and read through the options carefully

The course is a lot of understanding the concepts, and Zatzick does brief explanations of the concepts in his lectures. Only a few topics will be gone over in detail, so do read the textbook for completeness in covering the material. He is a good prof, and the course itself is not too difficult.

He tells you exactly what will be on the test and gives interesting examples during class. He doesn't make you remember anything that was not discussed in class and this make studying for tests easier. He was the best professor I had during the semester. I would recommend taking this class with him.

Chris was the best business prof I have had so far at Beedie and BUS 272 with him was fantastic. Although he had two hour lectures they were engaging and informative. Exam criteria was given to students and everyone knew what to expect; there were no surprises. One issue people had were the group projects, but that's expected in a business course.
Chris is such an amazing prof. He engages with students, tells you exactly what will be on the final exam and is so helpful! 100% recommend this course with him
This class is extremely straightforward. Chris tells you exactly what he wants you to know for each exam, and is extremely clear with his expectations. Just show up to class and study the material
one of the best prof

This class will be most appealing to actual OB/HR majors or students passionate in psychology, sociology, etc. Midterm and final are focused on applications of OB concepts to scenarios in a business environment, but most of this class is based on memorization and definition of concepts and terms.
Very good professor ... explains everything clearly and keeps lectures interesting. Very skillful at making exam questions.

Amazing professor, one of the best I've had at SFU so far. His lectures are really engaging, you always want to go to class. He is always very helpful too when it comes to clarifying and helping you understand a concept. If he is available as a prof, take the class with him you won't regret it!

Chris Zatzick is an amazing prof, im lucky to have him and i hope to have him in my later courses. He explains it so well incoporating examples and helps students understand. *Exam tests on examples he uses in the class* Just be willing to learn and you will do great. This course is really easy to comprehend! good luck!
Prof is ok but you need to be lucky to not have one useless TA. All your grades expect for the exams totally depend on your TA.
Fun and interesting lectures. Fair marking for proj and exams.

I wish I had bought the online OB lab.. or used the one provided online... apparently you can get a better mark easier. I found the midterms and exams challenging (multiple choice and a few short answer). He tries really hard to make a boring class less boring which I think is a sign of a good prof. Group project was a pain, but whatever.
Best Prof to take BUS 272 with, his explanations are crystal clear and gives interesting insights that make the class enjoyable. Test are extremely fair and quite easy

Chris is a very capable and engaging lecturer. The M/C on exams is fair, very few trick questions. I thought the midterm short answer was a bit difficult, but final was all M/C. I liked that exams were based only on material presented in lecture. Pay attention to his stories and videos, he likes to test on them. Tutorial is a waste of time.

He is a great prof. I enjoyed attending his class very much and his lectures were never boring. Also a plus, he based his exams only on lectures and not on readings. The readings were just supplemental.
Lectures move smoothly, tells you what part is on the midterm and final. just attend classs and copy the notes, solid class aside from the group project
Awesome!
Take Him! He keeps course easy. Make sure to attend ALL lectures, and take notes. ENjoyed this class!!! btw, take William as a TA (Like, his marking manner)
Very interesting content, but don't dream to get a A on it unless you memorize all the content. Exams are not as easy as you may thought.
Bus 272 was suppose to be one of the easier courses of the lower core levels but he made the exams/marking very difficult.

Chris isn't a bad professor in general, his assignments however, are harder compared to other bus 272 profs.  Also, at least 5-10% of the midterm and final, are based on either videos from lecture, or things he said in lecture, so it is mandatory to pay attention and attend class. And he marks really really slow 1week+ for scantron test.... --"
Nice and helpful professor, gives a clear lecture, explains well. Recommended! Midterm and Final are fair. All unfair things happended in tutorial, can you choos a good TA?

Chris is one of my favourite profs at SFU. Very clear in lectures and extremely organized. All his TAs were awesome too. midterm was hard, but final was fair. If you read the parts of the book he tells you to, you will do fine. Overall, very good prof!

Attendance for this course is not mandatory,but you'd better show up and  pay attention to his lecture.My English is kinda poor,but his lecture is very clear and interesting to me.The thing i like most is that it is not nessary to read the whole textbook!The only thing I dislkie is that i have to do a group project and paticipate in tortorial.

I was very interested in the material, but that was before I took this class! His lectures are super boring but you have to go because he gives away exam hints. The midterm was brutal, even the T.A. admitted some of the questions were completely unfair. He seems like a nice enough person but not a very good prof. Go with another prof!!!

Chris is friendly and very approachable. It can get boring sometimes attending his lectures but he only tests you on what he talks about in lectures! No need to read whole chapters! He tells you his exam formats but I find the mc to be tricky and the written to be about very specific stuff. Make sure you go to class, it'll help a lot.

He's a good prof actually. His lecture is interesting. I don't think his exam is very hard cuz he gave us the study guide before exams. Also, he mentioned what would be the exam questions during the lecture sometimes, so pay attention to what he said.
one word to describe him: VAGUE.

Awesome prof! Wasn't really interested in course before taking it...but loved it!  Group essay was awful because my group members had terrible English.  Tests ok...lots of none of the aboves (making it tricky).  Very interesting and well organized lectures.  Approachable and very friendly. I would take any class that he was teaching just for him as
prof was really straight to the point, but the exams are HARDDD... lots of 'none of the aboves' or 'all of the aboves' or 'only A&C is true', etc... becareful when doing MCs
exams are super hard. Be sure to listen and take notes in lecture. You have to know beyond the textbook and know how to apply theories
He just started teaching again after taking time off to raise alpacas. Talks a lot about alpacas and underpants. Excellent teacher when he is sober, which is most of the time.
Good teacher, but weird.  Starts classes by describing his underpants.  Covers a lot of material (no pun intended).  Is shaped ike a pear, but in a good way.
Lots of stories about the time he spent in Wales helping sheep give birth.
No Comments
No Comments
Excellent prof, looks very good in his suits.

Professor Assadi gives incredible lectures, she is funny, but doesn't veer off topic much. Go to the lectures, there are bonus points that go toward your final. Speaking of her exams, they are incredibly disorganized and confused weirdly. Plus, her group assignments SUCK. She's amazing, but the course structure/exams needs serious revamping.
Midterm was pretty hard, lots of tricky questions.

Dr. Assadi had decent lectures. At times, it got boring but she'd use videos and class participation to make it more engaging. Make sure you study well for the exams as a majority of the grades are on there and its fairly easy to study for if you put effort using flashcards and memorization and really understanding the concepts.

Good teacher. As long as you read and understand textbook/lectures you are going to do great! The group projects are kinda annoying but you just gotta deal with it. Other than that it was an okay class, lectures would just get boring.

Super nice prof! Class was based on 2 group projects, tutorial attendance, a midterm and a final (non cumulative). Memorize everything from the slides including examples, and understand the concepts to be able to apply in scenario based questions. Textbook is a lot of reading, majority of the content is already on the slides.
At times this class was extremely easy and at times I wanted to drive off a cliff because of it.

I don't know how people are complaining are so much that final was very easy if you just read all the lectures even like one time. Don't get thrown off by negative reviews, prof is completely fine, it's just the actual content is so boring.
Just avoid at all costs

The midterms and finals are absolutely brutal including random excerpts from examples in lecture as questions. Papers are graded brutally and the TA didn't seem to actually put in much effort. Prof seems superficially nice but I cannot say one good thing about this course.
Everyone, please choose Prof.Assadi's 272/381 class please! I took both with her, she is really a great one for all of the HR faculty!!!!
Best prof ever for all the BUS272 Instructors!
She is so nice! When I talked to her about the concerns about the exams, she comforted me and really gave a lot of useful tips to write and review the exams!!! Thank you Bahareh!
This lady is the best prof for BUS272, with not too many team works and an easier workload for the course! As a lower-division student, I highly recommend.
Really nice Prof, compare to the E100 section, she is the GOAT!!
Awful Professor, told by her that "as long as I did the peer view, you will receive full mark". But by the end, she didn't follow her word. Hope she can one day be disqualified by the SFU. Ewwww

Midterms and finals have 3 versions. One is easy while two are extremely difficult, hence resulting in a high curve. If you get a bad group not much will be done. The ones with the harder paper will always get a bad grade. Please just avoid if you want a good grade.

Bahareh was a great professor! If you want to do well in her course remember to assist to the tutorials! Also, if you participate in her class I think it will count as your participation grade and it will add up so much towards your grade! Although participation is not mandatory during her class, it is strongly encouraged!

there's so many reviews saying that she's not a good prof, so I was worried when I took this course with her, but she's a great prof I think people are just lazy and don't study and then blame it on the prof :/. She gives extra credit each class if you participate, her lectures are also really interesting and she always ends class early

Dr. Assadi is a wonderful professor. She cares about her students and gives lots of opportunities for extra credit. She is very friendly and makes her lectures a very welcoming space for students to participate. She is hard marker but if you read the textbook and really understand the information you will do just fine in her class.

In terms of lectures, she isn't the driest or worst prof I've had, but in terms of marking, she's brutal. Exam questions are usually multiple choice but too vague to have one clear answer, and you won't be able to argue your reasoning to her because she is very stubborn. Study the textbook completely, as that's where most exam questions are from.

The moment she spoke I knew right away that shes good. I could listen to her speak for 2 hrs & I learned a lot about OB. To be fair, she gave us full marks for questions in Finals that were not taught in class & we got 80 mins for 70 questions. Yes she has high standards & I still don't have the courage to read her feedback on our group paper :)

Most unfair teacher I have ever had and I've had many. Do not take any course with her. The test was crazy. As a student that does not reform well under pressure this class messed me up. The ta was really nice tho. The final was and the quizzes are 1 minute per question. Which is impossible. Question type was comprehensive with one min per quest...
She's a good prof. There is a group paper and presentation, plus weekly quizzes.

Bahareh is a good prof. She teaches well and explains all course concepts well. However, she is such a tough marker that it's hard to get a good grade in this class and the final exam will drop your mark because she may put questions in there you didn't really learn about. Overall she is nice and cares about her students but be aware of her marking

Shes a good prof! Engaging lectures and weekly quizzes are easy. However, I was stuck with a very uncooperative group for the project and she was not at all very helpful with the situation. Often profs dont change groups so be prepared to work in a major project with people who possibly may not do any work and a prof who wont do much about it

Lectures were engaging, although it seemed like a reiteration of the textbook, she presented it well with her own additions. Grading criteria for everything was very vague so it was hard to do well. Group paper was also a pain to do. Final was very hard and didn't make much sense. Time limit was too short since all questions were scenarios.

I took this prof cuz of the good reviews. She is a nice and calm prof but her final exam was not as what we expected. She clearly made the TAs to create quiz and exam questions. Final was all scenario questions with a short time limit. I am pretty sure she mentioned that it was going to be open book but changed it to close book last min!

Her lectures were clear and participation helped us learn and apply the material. The tests were mostly based on lectures. Group paper is tough as you cant pick group members and there is no way to report how much they contributed. Class average was high

I didn't care much about the lectures, but the tutorials were where I learnt the most. Simply because the smaller cohorts made it easier for me to discuss ideas/theories with my peers. The TA helped me with understanding the material and setting me up for success. I really valued the prompt email response I got, especially prior to the midterm. Ty
He is ok, but there has another better professor to choose

She is super funny and makes sure to brighten up the dry material that tends to come with business. The work was hard, but if you attend all lectures and tutorials, and do the hw then it isn't hard to come up with a solid mark. The only thing that was hard was the group projects. Just depends which teammembers you get!

Terrible class. For both BUS 272 and BUS 237. She seems to just read off the lecture slides. Moreover, answers written on exams were worded a little differently from what she had on the answer sheet and you don't get any marks for it. Same meaning, just different words. If you can choose any other prof, take them.

This was not a useful course.   I think Zorana tried to make it easier by going very slowly and telling a lot of pointless stories. Avoid her class if you have the option and watch TV if you just want to see pointless stories. Why is 272 mandatory??

Seems fun at first, by the end of the semester you'll hate her & her accent. She is absolutely useless for any questions about the course. Exams are based on lecture notes yet she still makes you read the entire textbook and take an online quiz for every chapter. And don't even get me started about the group paper. Dumbest assignment ever!

Awesome prof! She is definitely not easy but if you work hard you will do well in this course. The only bad thing is the group project since you get randomly assigned groups and you'll most likely get a free-rider in your group. Her exams are very fair and study off her lecture notes!
Favourite business professor ever ! Made the class really interesting and love her personality ! Just have to read the book and study the notes, you will do fine !

She is so great, you won't miss such a courteous prof. in pursuing your degree life. Helpful and caring, she will do her best to help you even though herself is a very busy person (PHD candidate. Love her so much, thanks,Miss Z ^.^
If you want/need to take bus 272, take it with Zorana! She's interesting and the lectures were fun! all you have to do is memorize  the content of the book and you will be fine on exams.
For the midterm and final, read and memorize the textbook, thats all. The content is so easy, but remember its curved, so every bit counts.

Had her as my professor and TA for Bus272 this semester. Definitely enjoyed getting to know her a bit personally. She is a very interesting person, and I liked her classes. Oh, and she likes to laugh a lot.

This was her first time teaching 272 so I think she went easy.  Exams were ridiculously easy (average 80%).  The group project marking scheme was dumb though, hope she changes that.  Overall easy course, tutorials were fun too.

She's a really good prof, I really recommend her. She's funny and good at explaining everything. He marking is also easy and fair. Overall good cours and good prof. I think she's the best prof for this course.
RUN!!!!!! Choose another prof instead of him please!

He is a great professor: really cares for all his students, has so many amazing stories to share. As long as you memorize his slides, it's very easy to get full marks on midterms and finals. Get ready for a lot of assignments: that's where I feel I lost some marks. I definitely recommend taking a class with him. Best prof so far!
His lectures are inspiring but lecture notes are lacking.  You need the textbook to make sense of things
Really great prof. Class was enjoyable. Hope to take him again.

Sam was very inspirational and was also quite passionate about teaching. The issue was that he wasn't too interested in the content he was teaching. He would often spend a fraction of the lecture teaching the content and the rest talking things to inspire the class. You can do well without going to lectures just make sure to read the textbook.

Sam is a very good professor who is really passionate about the subjects he teaches, and really wants to help students reach their full potential. His exams are very fair, with no unexpected content and a focus on demonstrating understanding of the concepts in a real world scenario, not just focusing on writing down the exact definition.
Midterm and finals were pretty straight forward. Group and pair projects pretty much make or break your grade. Sam is a great lecturer and will go the extra mile to help you out.

amazing person and knowledgable, but lectures can be pretty boring, i stopped going after the first few weeks. ur grade is based on lots of group project, so if u get assigned with a bad group, it will be hard to get a good grade. u dont get most of ur marks back till end of semester, so u dont know ur true grade

Amazing person, very kind, fair grading, and fair exams.  A few complaints was the high average can be dissapointing when grades are curved at the end and it took more than a month to get marks back for assignments.

If you want to actually learn HR, take this course with another prof. Everything was so disorganized, too many assignments and all useless. The lectures were BORING and repetitive. He talked too much about himself. For the presentation (20%), he even added more rubrics AFTER we submitted, and deducted a lot for rubrics that no one knew about.

good prof except this course will make you so bored. I also don't like how long it takes for marks to be returned and being left not knowing what grade you are truly at throughout the sem. the group projects are a large portion of your grade, so if you get a bad group it would be extremely difficult especially with such a high grade curve.

Sam is one of the best profs I've ever had. The weekly quizzes and open book midterm were quite easy however your grade heavily depends on group assignments and projects. Your group members are the same all semester so pray you get a good group.

After 4 semesters, Sam is without a doubt the best prof I have had thus far. While the content of the course may not always be interesting, his way of lecturing always captures your attention. If you come early, he always tries to make conversation and will remember your name. Very inspiring prof. Beware of group assignments however.
Sam has the power to bring out the leader in anyone. He is fantastic.
What the comment below just said!
Sam is the GOAT.
i learnt most stuff from the textbook but i still always attended lectures because i loved sam so much, he is such a good prof and will help you whenever you need

Sam is a real gem. I don't know what I did to deserve him. His lectures are really fun, he makes lots of jokes and don't give any extra homework other than quizzes. Above all, he doesn't expect us to memorize the book. Some said he do but that's not true. He wants us to understand and apply the concepts. I would love to take another class with him.

Exams are graded pretty harshly but the class is curved so doesn't really matter. Overall, Sam is very knowledgeable and seems sincere. The workload can be a bit heavy near the end of the semester with the final case study, the two micro assignments, and the final so beware of time management!

I hate his class . He provides so many assignments and presentations for a 200 level course . The course itself is so boring and he doesnt add any justice to make it easy for students. Marking for assignments and projects are rough and not fair because I had the worst TA .

Sam is the best prof I've had so far. He made group work easy and the marks were very fair. He recorded his live lectures. The exam is open book and based off of application rather than memorization. As long as you do the work you will succeed. He was very understanding of the online situation. Totally recommend taking this class with him!

Tons of group work. 3 group micro assignments, 1 paired presentation, and 1 group presentation, weekly reading quizzes. Sam's lectures were engaging and fun, he likes to joke, and we all throw out answers and examples in the chat. You can tell hes an awesome person. Exams are open book and I would say theyre fair/you have to work for a good mark.
Nice guy, very inspirational . Lectures are interesting for the most part, but he's really passionate about what he's teaching and knows his stuff.

Sam seems like he has good intentions, but this class is actually horrible. Everyone has different due dates for projects which is completely unfair as some students would have to hand things in and present 2 weeks before others. Also he expects you to memorize the entire textbook for exams to the smallest detail which he tests. Regret this class.
How do i start. Amazing prof yeah yeah but the course is on a different level of being boring. Sam expects you to memorize the whole book. LIKE EVERYTHING. Do you know how boring the material is.

While Sam is a good speaker and brought in some interesting guests, I didn't enjoy the class. The exams were memorizing the textbook and the group projects were harshly graded. OB can be confusing and I didn't feel that Sam really helped my understanding.

The absolute best prof I've ever had. He care's about his students and really wants to get to know you. His lectures are interesting and engaging. His assignments are fair and he gives you fair warning about what the midterm and final will look like. He's fairly acessible and someone you want to remain in touch with even after the course ends.

Sam really isn't your stereotypical business prof. He's a fine lecturer, and an amazing mentor. His real strength is in motivating you and building character, not just your grades. He's willing to help you one on one, no matter the subject. He's someone you want to keep in touch with after you graduate.

He can surely communicate but honestly not that good of a prof. The course itself was too basic and Sam did not really add to it. Comes off as way too naive and could do with talking less about himself. Wouldnt recommend the course or the prof unless you really need to

While the course content may not be too interesting for everyone, taking BUS 272 with Sam is worthwhile. He truly cares about his students and their future. His tests are fair and primarily based on the textbook. Presenatations are a bit more difficult in terms of grading but still very manageable. Highly recommend taking BUS 272 with Sam!

Genuinely cares for your success. I was a week and a half late for the start of school due to a summer trip back to Asia; I emailed him to see if there was anything I could do to stay caught up other than his online posted lectures. Sam literally sent me assignment briefs and paired me up with a presentation partner before hand. Amazing person. D
He is a very nice man and he work hard. The exam is on textbook more than lexture and I would like him to teach more about the exam because course is not really fair this way.

Amazing prof!! Would love to take another class with him. Amazing lectures, accessible outside class, inspirational. DO NOT SKIP CLASS or your missing on something very important that you will never be able to learn.

Sam is the best professor I have met so far. He is inspiring and very humor. He cares about every single one of us and as long as you put in the effort with group project and study the textbook, you will get a really good grade
One of my favourite professors at SFU so far! Felt very welcoming whenever I was in his lectures despite the fact that it was a class of 200+.

Sam's a great prof who cares about his students and encourages students to participate in class. However, no rubric for projects so we don't know what we lost marks on. Also, don't expect to get your grades right away. All of them will show up after the semester ends. Nothing was marked except for the midterm before evaluations so don't be fooled.
Sam is friendly and positive. The course didn't say anything new but that isn't Sam's fault.  I'd like to take a more meaningful class with him.

Sam is a great professor. Although his lectures aren't too interesting, he does what he can to keep the class engaged and informed. He truly loves his job and cares for his students, and you don't see that passion around much anymore. Take any class with Sam, and seek support if you need it. He's awesome.

Bill Scott is a tremendous professor. He is friendly, approachable, and he cares about his students. His lectures are quite informative and inspirational. He answers emails in good time and makes the work clear. There are quite a few assignments in BUS 272, but they are fair and explained well for the most part. I would recommend Professor Scott

for 3credits, there was ALOT of assignments. besides the weekly quizzes, there was always sum to do almost every week, sometimes the assignment would overlap and you end up doing 2 things. they're all group work so if you end up with bad members, you'll do bad. you'll end reading the whole textbook cuz his sides are bad. He's a good teacher tho

Very friendly and responds to emails quickly. Exams are fair but wording can be vague--focus on applying concepts as exams are all written application questions and no MC. Bill is clearly passionate about teaching and cares for his students, def take it w/ him (he made a wheel of fortune game to make lectures more fun and engaging for students)! :)
Bill Scott is a solid choice. I took BUS 272 online and the course structure is quite simple and easy. Overall the course is quite basic/simple.

pair projects and group projects. course concepts are fairly easy to understand. however you need to actually know what you're learning about to do well. memorization does not help. he's a nice guy and his lectures are interesting. a good beginner business course

Very "liberal" course. Loads of group projects and in class activities. The concepts were not difficult, weekly quizes were easy and the professor and TA marked assignments fair. The mid term and final are largely multiple choice and honestly kind of tricky.
Worst professor ever had. His lecture is useless and the PowerPoint are useless at all! Dont take his class. It is chaotic!
Worst professor I have ever had. Extremely boring lectures and never cover the main point! Always ask us to do group interactions but is bored to death! Hate him a lot!
Lectures were whack, not really required. Group project is fairly straight forward and simple. Midterm was easy, but final was very difficult. Basically a really easy class up to the final.

Michael did everything he could to be engaging, I found it to be too much. There were constant surveys, polls, and stories in class that felt like I never knew when to actually write down or pay attention to what he was saying

Beyond useless. Poor excuse for a lecturer. Way below sfu standards. Students deserve their money back if they took the course with him. Could have just red the hbr articles he assigned and done well on the final. Waste of money. This prof cant even finish a sentence without stuttering and correcting himself. Then does useless polls.

RUN AND DROP this class if you want to take OB as required. Throughout the semester, quizzes and poll were all I can remember. If you want to learn something and get at least a good grade, GO TO OTHER PROFS

DO NOT TAKE CLASS WITH HIM! It will be time-consuming and waste lots of your money if you take the class with him, also you will feel stressed about his horrible teaching. Be aware of his videos because the exam will ask for it! Recommend to drop his class immediately otherwise your GPA will be ruined tbh

HORRIBLE lectures, he doesn't teach anything. He doesn't use his own lecture slides, he just uploads Pearson's "lecture slides"to canvas which is just the same points in the textbook but in a powerpoint. He brings nothing of value, and the only reason people attended his lectures were because he had random pop quizzes throughout the semester.

Nice guy who is super passionate however USELESS lectures, can't communicate, horrible grading as in hes oddly specific about what he wants despite there being a clear rubric and he wont tell you where to improve "because he wants you to do it by yourself". Irrelevant lectures, horrible marking, horrible communication, RUN.
Blazes through slides, super nice guy but content seems empty, will spend lots of time on obvious questions that no one wants to answer instead of on testable material

Michael was a very knowledgeable prof in terms of BUS 272 and tried his best to encourage class participation in every lecture, even when there were only 12 people in the lecture hall. All his exams are multiple choice, just do the pearson online questions and you will be fine.
The fairest and most understanding prof I have had to date. Her lectures were above average and it felt like she was walking you through the course content.

Lisa is a really nice prof, I recommend taking her for 272 as she gets straight to the content. Lecture attendance isn't mandatory, but tutorials are (marks for participation). Group presentation, and mini written assignments add to marks. Midterm and Final are based off slides + text, and are similar to the Mylab questions.

Very kind professor who is willing to help students succeed. Her lectures are entertaining and help with understanding the course content. Class is entirely based on textbook so focus on that when studying for exams. Overall a super nice prof who cares about her students.

Lisa is kind, helpful, and creative in the way she explains stuff. She encourages people to speak up and share stories. Tutorials are fun and interesting. The textbook is your best friend nevertheless. Grading criteria are a little unclear for midterm & final. Attendance is worth 20% so you can not miss lectures/tutorials at any cost.
Lisa was super nice, assignments and tests were straightforward and based off material. The content was somewhat interesting. Overall a good class and a great professor.

Lisa's pretty nice and relatable. She goes through and provides good real-life examples of organizational behavior theories. Tries to engage class by welcoming and posing questions. I found myself bored but I think it was more the content than Lisa's teaching style.

SARB HOVEY DOES NOT RESPECT HER STUDENTS. SHE IS ALWAYS RUDE TO HER STUDENTS AND NOT A GOOD LISTENER. SHE WILL ALWAYS DEFEND HER SIDE AND WILL SHUT YOU UP INFRONT OF THE CLASS! SHE MAKES HER STUDENTS FEEL DUMB AND DOES NOT ENCOURAGE CLASS PARTICIPATION. SHE GIVES LOW GRADES TOO! DONT TAKE HER AS YOUR PROF!
Her lectures are not interesting. A lot of memories. The harder you work on it, the better grade you get.

Many Presentations and reports to do in her class but the main thing is she gives everyone almost the same grade. The class average was pretty low. Easy to get a C but hard to get B's or A's in her class. Her marking guide was hilarious.  Hard work does not deserve A's in her class.
The best thing about Sarb's class is that she's always there for you, if you regularly participate in class, and do the readings before hand you're good to go.
Her classes are not as bad as the rating. She explains the content clearly and the exams are not too difficult. I think she is a good teacher

I checked the reviews on Sarb before enrolling in a class but I was left with no option in the end. I really expected the worst but I've learnt not to treat RMP ratings as the basic truth. She's not the greatest teacher in the world and one thing she said is that it is her job to teach and not entertain. If only she were more engaging
very boring prof. lectures are very boring and she talks very very quietly
Her lectures are really boring, but the exams are super easy and straight from the textbook. Tutorials are useful and interesting. Super easy to get a good grade in this class.
Her voice is very monotonous and she speaks really quietly. Take this class with Chris if you can.
Very monotone lectures and teaches the same things that can be read in the textbook.

Horrible Professor. Incredibly boring and just made slides from the textbook. Lecture attendance was sometimes as low as 30/200. The power-points were helpful but she really needs to start being louder and more interesting.

I've been attending SFU for 2 semester but she is probably the worst professor I've ever had so far... and also one of the worst speakers also... None of my friends and group mates attend the class because the way she speaks makes her lecture a waste of your time. Class average is wayyyy lower than other BUS 272 classes STAY AWAY FROM HER

Her lectures are Extremely boring and hard to listen to. Lots of memorization so do the readings. Cant even find the free version of the textbook so had to buy it. So many term to learn and not many assignments or opportunities to bring up your mark. She talks about whats covered on the test in class so go to lectures

Incredibly dry class, but Melissa tries her best to make it engaging. Lots of content and information to memorize for midterm and final, so read the textbook well beforehand. The content itself is not difficult, just lots of information and terms to memorize. Fairly easy class if you're good at memorization.
Loved Melissa for 272! TA was also awesome. Tests are heavy though, prepare to study lecture slides and read the text. Highly recommend!

The worst 272 prof across the Bby and Surrey campus. Dragged lectures too long making it extremely hard to stay awake and alert, and excessively difficult midterm and final compared to other classes. Emphasis on the excessivley! DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS!
She is so bad for BUS272, come on! How's your exam looks like that? Worst Prof I have ever met!

if you have a choice don't choose her as ur prof. final was so hard, nothing could prepare you unless u remember everything from every lecture leading up to it. final was cumulative and was prolly one of the worse written exams ive ever wrote. suppose to be easier class but she made it harder than needed. she's a nice person tho. but DONT TAKE IT
Meh.  Not the best, not the worst.  I'll probably forget the whole class by next year.

she is a great prof, try to make  things clear, and fun. if you memory sucks like me, don't choose her if you want to get a good grade coz her exam is easy (average of MT and paper are 70%). but iverall she is a great prof~! =)
He is nice.

Lieke is a great prof! Her lectures are very interesting, she includes videos & examples which is helpful but also you wouldn't expect those to pop up on tests but they can. Her lecture slides have all the info you need, but the text book goes into detail so the choice is yours. class is curved and av. was rlly high but overall great class!!

Was doing fine until the team assignment. She and the TA's went hard on the grading, and completely destroyed some people's mark. I dropped in total of 3 grades from a B+ down to a C. Absolutely pissed right now. Avoid her class unless you wanna see your mark go from a high down to low because of the harsh grading.
Lieke is awesome, she really cares about her students. If you are having difficulty in her class, just ask! She will go above and beyond to make sure you understand

The best prof i never met before. Really care about her students. This course is not hard, especially if you take this course with lieke. Make sure take this course with lieke, because you will have much less work.

Lieke clearly cares about her work, however she doesn't give super interesting lectures. This class has quite a bit of work to it but you'll do fine by going to her lectures and knowing the material from the slides. Also, semester-long group project.

Lieke is honestly an amazing prof, everything is straight forward and follows her lecture slides. Hard to find a prof that's actually passionate on what they teach and shows it in the lecture. Lots of terms and memorization but I found everything related to each other. Textbook is supplementary but definitely can help bump you an extra letter grade

This course is an easy A although the average is very high. As long as you follow her lecture slides and understand the main idea behind each theory, you are good. Just beware of team assignment and spend time working on it. Your grades depend on TA too

Lieke is a very average business prof. Her lectures  can be boring and are not mandatory. Her exams are super easy. I got an A in the course with 88% and minimal effort. Average was a bit lower then I expected but still kind of high. Textbook not mandatory, but supplements the lecture slides which can bump you up a letter grade.

Not only one of the best professors I've had, but also one of the best people I have met. Lieke is devoted, passionate, humble, and truly always ready and willing to help. Get to know her, and use her energy and availability to make the most out of her course. You will gain deep and wide awareness on the psychological basics of business.

Sweetest prof you'll meet. Lectures can be boring as she most of the information can be found in the book but she'll add in tidbits of information not inside the book. Tests contain stuff from textbooks and her lectures. Assignments are difficult, and grading criteria is pretty ambiguous.

One of my favourite profs. Totally accessible outside of class, willing to answer any questions in class. totally fair grading and marking, and is 100% open to feedback and changing how she teaches. The tests are fair, MC heavy, easy if you read the textbook and the lecture notes.

Good prof, fair exams, explains everything really thoroughly ( or attempts to ), and is caring. High curve, so it's not an easy A at all, and she even showed us the cutoff point which is less than 1%. I would say it's almost a guaranteed B/B+ if you're competent enough but you need some luck ( group projects and good TA ) to really make a diff.

Not really understanding the low rating for this prof. She explains things very clearly, gives very fair exams, and doesn't throw any negative surprises at you. Course content is easy, and the curve is high, but if you actally put in the effort it isn't hard to do well. Group projects obviously can be annoying, but the course is about teams so....

Good prof, humble and caring. Fair bit of individual and team homework/project so be ready to work. Tests are fair and lots of people score well so the curve is high. If you're doing well, you'll be happy. If don't get it, then you'll complain. Just like any other course.

Love her! She definitely knows what she's talking about and can apply the theories in ways that make sense. High curve, but if you can sit down and read/summarize/memorize a ton of content, get a good group, and are a strong writer for the individual cases, you're good to go.

class is super subjective. Makes you regurgitate theories that are plagued with huge controversy. It's like creating a bunch of students who memorize and apply theories and luckily gets it right because it aligned with hers and TAs views. Should teach us to analyze each variable and teach us to problem solve through applying logic on each variable

She sticks to what's in the textbook. I liked that.  She also picked a very good textbook for my class at least.  the textbook is huge and you don't need to memorize everything, as long as you know the names of and understand the basic idea of all theories you will do well.  Her tests are fair.  I made my own notes at home.
Loved her and this class!
Tons of material that she does not cover in class for the exam.  Very boring subject and she makes it even worse.
Worst professor every. She can barely explain the topics and expects you to master material that she never gave on class.

She's really sweet and passionate about OB. Her exams are based of her lectures and they are very straight forward. Just review her lecture recordings and make notes on those before exams and you should be good to go. She's very helpful when it comes to the team project if you take the effort to meet with her she'll give you excellent feedback!
she's okay

First midterm was based off of 6 chapters- 230 pages long. It was all done under 4 weeks, an average of 60 pages to read. This is a psychology-based course with a ton of memorizing. Worst part is, the prof expects you to memorize everything. To make it worse, she adds other materials outside the textbook to add onto your test load.

Very nice person, looking to help you succeed in the class and is open to suggestions. Course content isn't hard, mostly common sense. Beware of the team paper it can be a pain if your group sucks. There was no peer evaluation but I talked to her about it after and she said she will add it in. Overall enjoyable but a few little annoyances.

Brummelhuis had very simplified lectures and while she didn't go into extensive details over things her exams were based solely off her lectures.  As long as you read her lectures and show up to class you're guaranteed a good grade
Lieke only gives a small part of information in lecture. Get ready to self study. Fortunately, the textbook is pretty clear compared to other business classes.

exams have questions not in lectures and textbook, boring lecturer, her questions are very subjective and are not consistent with lecture notes, often have to go in and complain for marks that should have been originally included, based on her thinking, CHOOSE DIFF PROF! individual assignment and team assignment are not bad because good TAs

Ron is a passionate instructor who is dedicated to unlocking the leadership potential in his students. He empowers his students by delivering thought-provoking lessons that delves into the emotional process people experience in a change initiative and the tools that future leaders need to keep our teams focused and productive.
So so so so much stuff need to remenber and he just tells u all the stuff would be on your final.

Ron is a very nice prof. He tries his best to help if there is any ambiguity. Most people found him unclear because they failed to go to his office hours. If you attend his office hours to clear up any confusion, he is quite helpful. He does want you to get a good grade so he will often do what he can to help you. Great prof!
He is definitely interested in the material however he could be a little more organized and clear in his instructions.

How can someone so disorganized teach Organizational behavior? He changes the team quiz material the day before the actual quiz, is super unclear about what he wants for the individual case project. Offers 0 help and directs you to the library like the lazy bum he is. Late for final by 30 minutes and wasted everyones time. DO NOT TAKE WITH RON.

The class is pretty easy as long as you study for the weekly team quizzes and do well on the individual assignment and group presentation. His midterm and final was fair, as long as you study the slides he gives you and skim through textbook, its a pretty easy A. Velin isnt that great though, he is a lazy and disorganized person.

Very fun and interesting teacher! Classes are always interactive and keeps you awake. Exams are very fair. However, the criteria for the individual assignment wasn't very clear, so that could be an area for improvement. As well, study for the weekly team quizzes and hope to get good team members!!

His teaching isn't a problem, however he is incredibly frustrating with his organization. Constantly changing the syllabus all the time and also at the last minute. Had to check the syllabus constantly for last minute changes.

Changes what the syllabus says will be on the team quizzes 10:30 the night before, more than once. Half an hour late to the Final, and didn't put up the outline for it until 12am the day of the final. He's a nice guy and pretty decent at communicating the material but majorly lacking in organization and preparation.
Not sure if you attended the same class. Made you work hard but fair in feedback and grade

Doesn't teach. always finishes the class half-1 hour before 2 hours is up. doesn't reply to emails. doesn't show up on midterm and final exams. very irresponsible.  he also requires us to read an additional boring book...

This was the hardest course I have taken so far in SFU.  Her exams were hard and lechures were boring.  I have nothing else to say except...don't take this course unless you really NEED it and don't expect it to be an easy ride because it would just end up slapping you in the face.
HE is not helpful,so bad
